reasoning: Primary spermatogenic failure is a chronic condition causing male infertility, measured by prevalence. Male infertility affects ~7% of men; primary spermatogenic failure accounts for ~30-40% of cases. Estimated ~800 per 100k total population (all ages/sexes).
source: Agarwal A et al. (2015). A unique view on male infertility around the globe. Reprod Biol Endocrinol. 13:37
